    • Method Detail

      • createObject

        public ObjectId createObject(java.lang.Object content,
                             java.lang.String contentType)
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Creates a new object in the cloud.
        Specified by:
        createObject in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        content - The initial content of the object. May be appended to later. May be null to create an object with no content. The content object can be any object type that is supported by the implementation.
        contentType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If null, defaults to application/octet-stream.
        Returns:
        ObjectId of the newly created object.

      • createObject

        public ObjectId createObject(ObjectIdentifier identifier,
                             java.lang.Object content,
                             java.lang.String contentType)
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Creates a new object in the cloud with the specified identifier.
        Specified by:
        createObject in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier to use for the new object. This may be an ObjectPath or an ObjectKey.
        content - The initial content of the object. May be appended to later. May be null to create an object with no content. The content object can be any object type that is supported by the implementation.
        contentType - the MIME type of the content. Optional, may be null. If null, defaults to application/octet-stream.
        Returns:
        ObjectId of the newly created object.

      • readObject

        public <T> T readObject(ObjectIdentifier identifier,
                        java.lang.Class<T> objectType)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Reads an object's entire content from the cloud.
        Specified by:
        readObject in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the object to read. May be any ObjectIdentifier.
        objectType - The type of object to return. This can be any object type supported by the implementation.
        Returns:
        An object (of type objectType) representing the content of the object in the cloud.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an exception occurs while reading the object. Note that IOExceptions are generally retried automatically (configured in AtmosConfig).

      • readObject

        public <T> T readObject(ObjectIdentifier identifier,
                        Range range,
                        java.lang.Class<T> objectType)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Reads an object's content from the cloud.
        Specified by:
        readObject in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the object to read. May be any ObjectIdentifier.
        range - (optional) The range of bytes to read from the object. A null value will read the entire object.
        objectType - The type of object to return. This can be any object type supported by the implementation.
        Returns:
        An object (of type objectType) representing the content of the object in the cloud.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an exception occurs while reading the object. Note that IOExceptions are generally retried automatically (configured in AtmosConfig).

      • updateObject

                         java.lang.Object content)
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Updates an object's content in the cloud.
        Specified by:
        updateObject in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the object to update. May be any ObjectIdentifier.
        content - The new content of the object. The content object can be any object type that is supported by the implementation.

      • updateObject

        public void updateObject(ObjectIdentifier identifier,
                         java.lang.Object content,
                         Range range)
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Updates an object's content in the cloud.
        Specified by:
        updateObject in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the object to update. May be any ObjectIdentifier.
        content - The new content of the object. The content object can be any object type that is supported by the implementation.
        range - (optional) The portion of the object to update (expressed as a range of bytes). A null value will overwrite the entire object.

      • getShareableUrl

        public java.net.URL getShareableUrl(ObjectIdentifier identifier,
                                    java.util.Date expirationDate)
                             throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Constructs a pre-signed URL to an object, which anyone can then use to retrieve the object. The URL expires at the specified time and is tamper proof. However, it does reveal the full tokenId of the user. If this is undesirable and the Atmos cloud is at version 2.1 and above, look at AtmosApi.createAccessToken(com.emc.atmos.api.request.CreateAccessTokenRequest).
        Specified by:
        getShareableUrl in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the object. Can be any ObjectIdentifier.
        expirationDate - The date at which the generated URL will no longer be valid.
        Returns:
        A public URL that will retrieve the contents of the specified object until expirationDate.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if the configured Atmos endpoint is syntactically invalid.

      • getShareableUrl

        public java.net.URL getShareableUrl(ObjectIdentifier identifier,
                                    java.util.Date expirationDate,
                                    java.lang.String disposition)
                             throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Constructs a shareable URL with a specific content-disposition. The disposition value will be set in the Content-Disposition header of the response when the URL is accessed. Requires the browser-compat feature, check ServiceInformation for supported features.
        Specified by:
        getShareableUrl in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the object. Can be any ObjectIdentifier.
        expirationDate - The date at which the generated URL will no longer be valid.
        disposition - the value of the Content-Disposition header, e.g. "attachment; filename=\"filename.txt\""
        Returns:
        A public URL that will retrieve the contents of the specified object and set the specified content-disposition until expirationDate.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if the configured Atmos endpoint is syntactically invalid.

      • getAccessToken

        public GetAccessTokenResponse getAccessToken(java.net.URL url)
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Retrieves details about the specified access token. Implementation simply extracts the token ID from the URL and calls AtmosApi.getAccessToken(String).
        Specified by:
        getAccessToken in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the access token.
        Returns:
        The response received from Atmos. This object contains the AccessToken, plus details about the response, such as headers (click on the class name to get more information).

      • deleteAccessToken

        public void deleteAccessToken(java.net.URL url)
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Deletes the specified access token. Implementation simply extracts the token ID from the URL and calls AtmosApi.deleteAccessToken(String).
        Specified by:
        deleteAccessToken in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the access token.

      • preSignRequest

        public PreSignedRequest preSignRequest(Request request,
                                       java.util.Date expiration)
                                throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Description copied from interface: AtmosApi
        Pre-signs a request with a specified expiration time. The pre-signed request can be executed at a later time via the AtmosApi.execute(com.emc.atmos.api.request.PreSignedRequest, Class, Object) method. This feature is useful if you intend to serialize the pre-signed request to some other system which does not have access to Atmos credentials.
        Specified by:
        preSignRequest in interface AtmosApi
        Parameters:
        request - the request to pre-sign (can be executed at a later time)
        expiration - the date at which the pre-signed request becomes invalid and will no longer be accepted
        Returns:
        a pre-signed request that can be executed at a later time and expires at expiration
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if the configured Atmos endpoint is syntactically invalid.
